prompt: Understand, adhere to, and promote professional ethics
completion: (ISC)² Code of Professional Ethics, Organizational code of ethics

prompt: Understand and apply security concepts
completion: Confidentiality, integrity, and availability, authenticity and nonrepudiation

prompt: Evaluate and apply security governance principles
completion: Alignment of the security function to business strategy, goals, mission, and objectives, Organizational processes (e.g., acquisitions, divestitures, governance committees), Organizational roles and responsibilities, Security control frameworks, Due care/due diligence

prompt: Determine compliance and other requirements
completion: Contractual, legal, industry standards, and regulatory requirements, Privacy requirements

prompt: Understand legal and regulatory issues that pertain to information security in a holistic context
completion: Cybercrimes and data breaches, Licensing and Intellectual Property (IP) requirements

prompt: Understand requirements for investigation types (i.e., administrative, criminal, civil, regulatory, industry standards)
completion: Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Develop and document the scope and the plan

prompt: Develop, document, and implement security policy, standards, procedures, and guidelines
completion: Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Develop and document the scope and the plan

prompt: Identify, analyze, and prioritize Business Continuity (BC) requirements
completion: Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Develop and document the scope and the plan

prompt: Contribute to and enforce personnel security policies and procedures
completion: Candidate screening and hiring, Employment agreements and policies, Onboarding, transfers, and termination processes, Vendor, consultant, and contractor agreements and controls

prompt: Understand and apply risk management concepts
completion: Identify threats and vulnerabilities, Risk assessment/analysis, Risk response, Countermeasure selection and implementation, Applicable types of controls (e.g., preventive, detective, corrective)

prompt: Understand and apply threat modeling concepts and methodologies
completion: Risks associated with hardware, software, and services, Third-party assessment and monitoring

prompt: Apply Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) concepts
completion: Risks associated with hardware, software, and services, Third-party assessment and monitoring

prompt: Establish and maintain a security awareness, education, and training program
completion: Methods and techniques to present awareness and training (e.g., social engineering, phishing, security champions, gamification), Periodic content reviews, Program effectiveness evaluation

prompt: Identify and classify information and assets
completion: Data classification, Asset Classification

prompt: Establish information and asset handling requirements
completion: Information and asset ownership, Asset inventory (e.g., tangible, intangible), Asset management

prompt: Provision resources securely
completion: Information and asset ownership, Asset inventory (e.g., tangible, intangible), Asset management

prompt: Manage data lifecycle
completion: Data roles (i.e., owners, controllers, custodians, processors, users/subjects), Data collection, Data location

prompt: Ensure appropriate asset retention (e.g., End-of-Life (EOL), End-of-Support (EOS))
completion: Data states (e.g., in use, in transit, at rest), Scoping and tailoring, Standards selection, Data protection methods (e.g., Digital Rights Management (DRM), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB))

prompt: Determine data security controls and compliance requirements
completion: Data states (e.g., in use, in transit, at rest), Scoping and tailoring, Standards selection, Data protection methods (e.g., Digital Rights Management (DRM), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB))

prompt: Research, implement and manage engineering processes using secure design principles
completion: Threat modeling, Least privilege, Defense in depth, Secure defaults, Fail securely, Separation of Duties (SoD)

prompt: Understand the fundamental concepts of security models (e.g., Biba, Star Model, Bell-LaPadula)
completion: Client-based systems, Server-based systems, Database systems, Cryptographic systems, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Cloud-based systems (e.g., Software as a Service (SaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS)), Distributed systems

prompt: Select controls based upon systems security requirements
completion: Client-based systems, Server-based systems, Database systems, Cryptographic systems, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Cloud-based systems (e.g., Software as a Service (SaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS)), Distributed systems

prompt: Understand security capabilities of Information Systems (IS) (e.g., memory protection, Trusted Platform Module (TPM), encryption/decryption)
completion: Client-based systems, Server-based systems, Database systems, Cryptographic systems, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Cloud-based systems (e.g., Software as a Service (SaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS)), Distributed systems

prompt:
Assess and mitigate the vulnerabilities of security architectures, designs, and solution
elements
completion: Client-based systems, Server-based systems, Database systems, Cryptographic systems, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Cloud-based systems (e.g., Software as a Service (SaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS)), Distributed systems

prompt: Select and determine cryptographic solutions
completion: Cryptographic life cycle (e.g., keys, algorithm selection), Cryptographic methods (e.g., symmetric, asymmetric, elliptic curves, quantum), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)

prompt: Understand methods of cryptanalytic attacks
completion:
Brute force
Ciphertext only
Known plaintext
Frequency analysis
Chosen ciphertext
Implementation attacks
Side-channel, Ciphertext only, Known plaintext, Frequency analysis, Chosen ciphertext, Implementation attacks, Side-channel

prompt: Apply security principles to site and facility design
completion: Wiring closets/intermediate distribution facilities, Server rooms/data centers, Media storage facilities, Evidence storage, Restricted and work area security

prompt: Design site and facility security controls
completion: Wiring closets/intermediate distribution facilities, Server rooms/data centers, Media storage facilities, Evidence storage, Restricted and work area security

prompt: Assess and implement secure design principles in network architectures
completion: Open System Interconnection (OSI) and Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) models, Internet Protocol (IP) networking (e.g., Internet Protocol Security (IPSec), Internet Protocol (IP) v4/6), Secure protocols, Implications of multilayer protocols, Converged protocols (e.g., Fiber Channel Over Ethernet (FCoE), Internet Small Computer Systems Interface (iSCSI), Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP)), Micro-segmentation (e.g., Software Defined Networks (SDN), Virtual eXtensible Local Area Network (VXLAN), Encapsulation, Software-Defined Wide Area Network (SD-WAN)), Wireless networks (e.g., Li-Fi, Wi-Fi, Zigbee, satellite), Cellular networks (e.g., 4G, 5G), Content Distribution Networks (CDN)

prompt: Secure network components
completion: Operation of hardware (e.g., redundant power, warranty, support), Transmission media

prompt: Implement secure communication channels according to design
completion: Voice, Multimedia collaboration, Remote access

prompt: Control physical and logical access to assets
completion: Information, Systems, Devices

prompt: Manage identification and authentication of people, devices, and services
completion: Identity Management (IdM) implementation, Single/Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), Accountability, Session management, Registration, proofing, and establishment of identity

prompt: Federated identity with a third-party service
completion: On-premise, Cloud

prompt: Implement and manage authorization mechanisms
completion: Role Based Access Control (RBAC), Rule based access control, Mandatory Access Control (MAC)

prompt: Manage the identity and access provisioning lifecycle
completion: Account access review (e.g., user, system, service), Provisioning and deprovisioning (e.g., on /off boarding and transfers)

prompt: Implement authentication systems
completion: OpenID Connect (OIDC)/Open Authorization (Oauth), Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML), Kerberos

prompt: Design and validate assessment, test, and audit strategies
completion: Internal, External, Third-party

prompt: Conduct security control testing
completion: Vulnerability assessment, Penetration testing, Log reviews, Synthetic transactions, Code review and testing

prompt: Collect security process data (e.g., technical and administrative)
completion: Account management, Management review and approval, Key performance and risk indicators, Backup verification data

prompt: Analyze test output and generate report
completion: Remediation, Exception handling, Ethical disclosure

prompt: Conduct or facilitate security audits
completion: Internal, External, Third-party

prompt: Understand and comply with investigations
completion: Evidence collection and handling, Reporting and documentation, Investigative techniques

prompt: Conduct logging and monitoring activities
completion: Intrusion detection and prevention, Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), Continuous monitoring, Egress monitoring

prompt: Perform Configuration Management (CM) (e.g., provisioning, baselining, automation)
completion: Need-to-know/least privilege, Separation of Duties (SoD) and responsibilities, Privileged account management

prompt: Apply foundational security operations concepts
completion: Need-to-know/least privilege, Separation of Duties (SoD) and responsibilities, Privileged account management

prompt: Apply resource protection
completion: Media management, Media protection techniques

prompt: Conduct incident management
completion: Detection, Response, Mitigation, Reporting

prompt: Operate and maintain detective and preventative measures
completion: Firewalls (e.g., next generation, web application, network), Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), Whitelisting/blacklisting, Third-party provided security services

prompt: Implement and support patch and vulnerability management
completion: Backup storage strategies, Recovery site strategies, Multiple processing sites

prompt: Understand and participate in change management processes
completion: Backup storage strategies, Recovery site strategies, Multiple processing sites

prompt: Implement recovery strategies
completion: Backup storage strategies, Recovery site strategies, Multiple processing sites

prompt: Implement Disaster Recovery (DR) processes
completion: Response, Personnel, Communications, Assessment

prompt: Test Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP)
completion: Read-through/tabletop, Walkthrough, Simulation

prompt: Participate in Business Continuity (BC) planning and exercises
completion: Perimeter security controls, Internal security controls

prompt: Implement and manage physical security
completion: Perimeter security controls, Internal security controls

prompt: Address personnel safety and security concerns
completion: Travel, Security training and awareness

prompt: Understand and integrate security in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
completion: Development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, DevOps, DevSecOps), Maturity models (e.g., Capability Maturity Model (CMM), Software Assurance Maturity Model (SAMM)), Operation and maintenance, Change management, Integrated Product Team (IPT)

prompt: Identify and apply security controls in software development ecosystems
completion: Programming languages, Libraries, Tool sets, Integrated Development Environment (IDE), Runtime, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)

prompt: Assess the effectiveness of software security
completion: Auditing and logging of changes, Risk analysis and mitigation

prompt: Assess security impact of acquired software
completion: Commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS), Open source, Third-party

completion:
